Text: Adjectives in -dicus, -ficus, and -volus form the Comparative and Superlative as though from forms in -dīcēns, -ficēns, -volēns, which were anciently used as adjectives.
Adjectives in -er form the Superlative by appending -rimus to the Nominative of the Positive. The Comparative is regular.

Five Adjectives in -ilis form the Superlative by adding -limus to the Stem of the Positive deprived of its final vowel. The Comparative is regular. They are facilis, difficilis, similis, dissimilis, humilis.
It appears to contain the old -mo-s (seen in prī-mus, mini-mus, etc.).
